    Team News

    Real Madrid
    • With Marcelo suspended, Carlo Ancelotti will be hoping that Fábio Coentrão is fully fit having missed out at the weekend.
    • Gareth Bale and Luka Modric both picked up injuries in the win over Malaga and will miss out for this crucial return leg versus Atletico, along with Karim Benzema, so Javier Hernandez is in line for a rare start up front.
    • Madrid deployed a 4-4-2 formation at the weekend and could do so once again in the absence of Bale.
    Atletico Madrid
    • Saul Ñíguez and Tiago are competing to replace the suspended Mario Suárez alongside Gabi in the midfield, with the experience of the latter perhaps giving him the edge.
    • Mario Mandzukic missed out at the weekend with a knock but should be fit enough to do battle with Ramos and co. once again.
    • Miranda and Siqueira should return to the backline at the expense of Gimenez and Gamez from the weekend's win over Deportivo.

    Prediction

    • After a stalemate in the first leg this game is finely balanced and after tempers began to boil over a week ago you can expect another blood and thunder affair come Wednesday.
    • The hosts could be derailed a little by injuries to both Modric and Bale at the weekend, while Simeone may well have a fully fit squad to choose from and will be confident of avoiding defeat for the 8th successive game against Los Blancos.
    • Bidding to retain their Champions League crown, Real Madrid will be slight favourites but Atleti are likely to push them all the way and we could yet be in for extra time in a repeat of last season's final
    Prediction:
    Real Madrid
    2
    1
    Atletico Madrid
